page.title: 16TAUNTON CASTLE
page.content: Taunton Castle is believed to date from Norman times.During the Civil War it was both a Royalist stronghold and later a Parliamentary garrison.It was used after the Monmouth Rebellion in 1685 for the Bloody Assizes which Judge Jeffreys held for captured rebels.This year is the 300 hundred anniversary of the rebellion and Taunton held a Son et Lumiere on Castle Green.Four loudspeakers were used to tell the story and floodlights lit up walls and trees in different colours. Smoke rose from behind a wall and the chopping of an axe was heard,the end of the Duke of Monmouth.Somerset County Museum is now situated in the castle building and the grounds now contain a hotel, two public houses,a cafe,a car park,a bingo hall,electricity showrooms and the bus station.
